intro: Commelina africana var. polyclada, commonly known as the African spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Commelinaceae family, characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves and vibrant blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. It produces small, three-lobed seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its spread. The leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
